Zann ChuaLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 28 Feb 2019Hello! There is no specific answer for this as it would likely depend on every individual. The problem with too much liquidity would be that it serves to distort financial markets and misallocates capital.
Ultimately, the right level of liquidity comes down to personal time preference for investors, financial objectives and reality for businesses, and the supply and demand for loans for central bank policy Hope this helps !0 comments0
